name: Ballet
description: Western art music, often Orchestral Music, written to accompany classical dance productions of the same name.

children.name: Ballet de cour
children.description: Earliest form developed by the French royal court and characterized by its artistic diversity, regimented structure, grand spectacle, and overt political elements.

children.name: Comédie-ballet
children.description: French form of musical drama from the 17th century that combines operatic singing, classical dance, and theater.

children.name: Opéra-ballet
children.description: Principally French style of musical drama that combines operatic singing with classical dance, usually with small Orchestral Music accompaniment.
